name: PowerShellOnTargetMachines
description: Execute PowerShell scripts on remote machine(s)
author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: EnvironmentName
inputs.label: Machine Group
inputs.helpMarkDown: Name of the Machine Group for deploying application.

inputs.name: MachineNames
inputs.label: Filter Criteria
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide a list of machines like dbserver.fabrikam.com, dbserver_int.fabrikam.com, 192.168.12.34 or tags like Role:DB;OS:Win8.1. Returns machines with either of the tags. For Azure Resource Group provide the VM Host Name for the machine name. The default is all machines in the machine group.

inputs.name: ScriptPath
inputs.label: PowerShell Script
inputs.helpMarkDown: Location of the PowerShell script on the target machines or on a UNC path like C:\BudgetIT\Web\Deploy\Website.ps1

inputs.name: ScriptArguments
inputs.label: Script Arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: Arguments for the PowerShell script. Can be ordinal parameters or named parameters like -testParam test

inputs.name: InitializationScriptPath
inputs.label: Initialization Script
inputs.helpMarkDown: Location of the data script for DSC on the target machines or on a UNC path like C:\BudgetIT\Web\Deploy\WebsiteConfiguration.ps1

inputs.name: RunPowershellInParallel
inputs.label: Run PowerShell in Parallel
inputs.helpMarkDown: Setting it to true will run powershell scripts in parallel on the target machines.

inputs.name: SessionVariables
inputs.label: Session Variables
inputs.helpMarkDown: Set common session variables for both the scripts. For example, $variable = value, $var1 = "value, 123"
